_documentation.overview: Night_watcher configuration file with vector store integration
_documentation.usage: This file controls system behavior across all Night_watcher components
notes: Fields beginning with underscore (_) are documentation only and ignored by code
All components read from this shared configuration for consistent behavior

content_collection._description: Settings for the content collection component
content_collection._article_limit_info: Maximum articles to collect per source

sources._note: NPR Top Stories - working RSS feed ✅
BBC US & Canada news - working RSS feed ✅
Federal Register presidential documents - working RSS feed ✅
Department of Labor releases - working RSS feed ✅
Alternative RSS feed for The Hill via RSS.app service
Fox News Politics for bias balance
White House main page scraping as fallback

content_collection._sources_info: List of content sources to collect from - mix of RSS feeds and web scraping for sources that discontinued RSS
content_collection._govt_keywords_info: Keywords used to identify politically relevant content
content_collection._max_workers_info: Number of concurrent threads for collection (reduced for stability)
content_collection._delay_between_requests_info: Delay in seconds between requests to avoid rate limiting (increased for better success)
content_collection._request_timeout_info: Request timeout in seconds (increased for better reliability)
content_collection._min_word_count_info: Minimum word count for valid articles (lowered for better collection)
content_collection._enable_deduplication_info: Whether to deduplicate content based on URL and content hashes

output._base_dir_info: Base directory for all data storage - can be overridden with --output-dir
output._save_collected_info: Whether to save collected content to individual files

llm_provider._description: Settings for the Large Language Model provider
llm_provider._host_info: Host URL for local LLM server
llm_provider._model_info: Model name to use with provider (when available)

analysis._max_articles_info: Maximum articles to analyze per run - can be overridden with --max-articles
analysis._include_kg_info: Whether to include knowledge graph generation in analysis

knowledge_graph._graph_file_info: Path to primary knowledge graph storage file
knowledge_graph._taxonomy_file_info: Path to knowledge graph taxonomy definition

vector_store._description: Vector store settings for semantic analysis
vector_store._base_dir_info: Base directory for vector store data
vector_store._embedding_dim_info: Dimension of embedding vectors (384 for MiniLM, 1536 for OpenAI)

input._file_pattern_info: Pattern to match for analysis files (default: analysis_*.json)

provenance._enabled_info: Whether to enable cryptographic provenance tracking system-wide
provenance._dev_mode_info: Development mode uses passphrase-derived keys instead of production key management
provenance._verify_info: Whether to verify provenance when loading documents/analyses, and skip items that fail verification

logging._level_info: Log level: DEBUG, INFO, WARNING, ERROR, or CRITICAL

content_sources: AP News and White House RSS feeds were discontinued - replaced with web scraping
Working RSS feeds include NPR, The Hill, BBC, CNN, Politico, Reuters, Federal Register, and DOL
Mix of RSS feeds and web scraping provides more reliable content collection
Web scraping sources may need periodic maintenance as sites change their structure
provenance: For production deployment, set dev_mode to false and implement proper key management
Ensure dev_passphrase is never used in production environments
Verification should be true to maintain strict chain of custody
security: In production, store this file with limited access permissions
Consider using environment variables for sensitive values
vector_store: For production deployment, consider using a dedicated vector database like Qdrant or Milvus
OpenAI embeddings provide better results but require API access and costs
Local embedding models are privacy-preserving but require additional disk space
